de.fu.weave.reflect
Class Action<M extends Module>

java.lang.Object
  de.fu.weave.reflect.Action<M>
Type Parameters:
M - The Class of the Module to which the Action belongs that is to be reflected
public class Action<M extends Module>
extends java.lang.Object

An ActionMethod represents a Method in a Module which can be executed by the Controller. Itâ€™s behvior is determined by Annotations from de.fu.weave.annotation.

Since:
Iteration2
Author:
Julian Fleischer

Constructor Detail

Action

Action(Module<M> parent,
       java.lang.reflect.Method method,
       java.lang.reflect.Method commitMethod)
 throws ModuleException
This is the one and only Constructor for this Class.

It is typically called from within a Module Reflector (Module), which passes itself as parent of this action. If checks if the action is valid, that includes, but is not limited to:

  1. Is the annotated method public?
  2. Are the Parameters well-defined?
  3. ...

Parameters:
parent - The modules this Action belongs to.
method - The Method reflector of the annotated Method.
commitMethod - The Method to be used on committing things. This may be null if such a Method does not exist.
Throws:
ModuleException - If the action is invalid.
Since:
Iteration2

invokeAction

public void invokeAction(GenericModule obj,
                         java.lang.String[] pathParts,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> requestParams)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                         java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
Invokes the action on a Module object

Parameters:
obj - The Module instance to invoke the method on
pathParts - An array of elements: the path requested
requestParams - A Map of parameters form a HttpRequest or something
Throws:
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - If the invoked action itself failed
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If the invoked action was not accessible since it is not public or so
Since:
Iteration2

isPermissionRequired

@XmlAttribute(value="permissionRequired")
public boolean isPermissionRequired()
Check whether a certain permission is needed to execute this Action.

This is the case if the requiredPermission is the empty String.

Returns:
true if a certain permission is needed
Since:
Iteration2
